title: What are the best books for packaging design? - Quora

response.answer_text: Packaging design is a very interesting discipline of design. Consumer study and market research are very important components necessary with the knowledge of design. The combination of functionality and attention-grabbing design needs to be seamless and worthy of recall. That’s why the study of packaging design branches into two parts, structural design, and graphic design. Here’s a list of books that the Design Square team at Bizongo swears by: 1)Branding: In Five and a Half Steps by Michael Johnson This book is a comprehensive book on branding with detailed case studies and a breakdown of how brands have applied subtle elements to make a giant impact in the market. 2)TM: The Untold Stories Behind 29 Classic Logos by Mark Sinclair Understand how well-known logos were designed and applied on different channels of communication. 3)Structural Packaging: Design Your Own Boxes and 3-D Forms by Paul Jackson The blurb of this book says it all - offers an in-depth understanding of how to create packaging forms for all types of packaging. This book is perfect for anyone designer who is looking to gain or brush up on their technical skills. 4)Best Practices for Graphic Designers, Packaging by Grip A step-by-step packaging process guide that is suitable for both experienced and novice professionals. You’ll understand everything from strategy to marketing, with information on conceptualization, choosing materials and even how to communicate with clients and vendors.
